intro: Eriogonum divergens, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Eriogonum divergens is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
